citations.narrative:
In December 2022, two bats died following the administration of injectable anesthesia by laboratory staff for a research
procedure in IACUC approved protocol 22-10-3; veterinary staff were contacted by the laboratory. The Attending
Veterinarian determined from the review of the anesthetic drug withdrawal procedure and the anesthetic dose calculations
performed by the laboratory staff, that the dose of anesthetic administered to the bats by the laboratory staff was higher
than in the approved protocol and the bats died from an overdose of the anesthetic agent.
Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel, including laboratory research staff, should be done as carefully
as possible in a manner that does not cause physical harm, behavioral stress, or unnecessary discomfort. The failure of
the laboratory staff to accurately calculate and prepare the dose of the anesthetic agent prior to administration of the
medication to the bats resulted in an overdose and the death of the two animals.
The Attending Veterinarian and research facility acted promptly to address this incident by investigating and implementing
corrective actions to prevent future incidents. Corrective actions included but were not limited to refresher training of the
laboratory staff on drug calculation and administration with the veterinary staff, and the veterinary staff will review all drug
calculations with the laboratory staff prior to administration to the animals. There have not been any additional incidents
after the implementation of these corrective actions.
This item was corrected by the research facility prior to the inspection.
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives on 7/12/23 and 7/13/23, and the exit briefing was held with
facility representatives on 7/13/23.
*END OF REPORT*
